column4: what is the best way to share files betwwen two ubuntu machines?
use a VPN
NFS is intended to be used in a setting where *you* control the IPs
I suppose I do control IP addesses on the local network, it still seems like a poor security model
it's not a security model
NFS is not intended to be secure.
if you want to secure it, you can use a VPN
I don't really understand when you say VPN I'll google it, my understanding of vpn was that you could connect two networks across an unsecured link (the Internet)
yes
but it also does authentication
if you want to secure NFS, you can use VPN and get authentication
oh... sounds complicated
it is, a bit
you can also just configure your NFS server to only serve things to trusted IP addresses and networks
it's adequate in a local network.
I'm probably beeing paranoid but if you have one machine on the local network that becomes compromised then all the security goes down the toilet
I think I might give sshfs a go
it seems like there is currently no good solution to share files between two computers over a network which is crazy
there are two good solutions
NFS is a good solution
and so is CIFS
yeah I suppose at least CIFS has password based permissions
it's not very secure by default though.
with NFS if someone gets control of one of the machines on your network what's to stop then changing the IP and getting access to any nfs share intended for any other computer on the network?
